title: Counter-Strike Source - v1.1a - 09.17.2013 [WTF] - No Steam - Mu
description:
Thank you for downloading the WTF release of Counter-Strike Source. This version is up to date as of 9/17/2013.

The release includes:
* Working Favorites/History
* Working Achievements
* Built-In Non-Steam Server List
* Clean release, no additional extras. As close to the retail game as possible.

NOTE: If you used the WTF Release 1.0, simply install 1.1a on top of the 1.0 version and you should retain your settings. Please do not use 1.1b as it uses a different emulator entirely! 

----------------Frequently Asked Questions----------------

Q: What is the difference between Counter-Strike Source x.xa and x.xb, eg., Counter-Strike 1.1a, Counter-Strike 1.1b?
A: They use different emulation. 1.xa has more features, but requires disabling UAC and running as administrator to grant a static Steam ID. In addition, some anti-virus software may cause the cstrike.exe file to be a false positive. As a result, if you are uncomfortable, please use x.xb. Both versions will be actively maintained.

Q: [Release 1.1a] I recieve the error "This server requires that you be running Steam." How do I fix it?
A: This usually means the emulator cannot generate a Steam ID. You need to disable UAC, restart, and run cstrike.exe (in the installation directory) as an administrator. 

Q: How do I change my name?
A: Please consult the rev.ini file. Additional (detailed) instructions are provided by typing "helpname" in console when you first start the game.

Q: How do I change my avatar?
A: Additional (detailed) instructions are provided by typing "helpavatar" in console when you first start the game. For a detailed guide please visit WT-F.com

Q: How do I change my game language?
A: Please consult the rev.ini file. Additional (detailed) instructions are provided by typing "helplanguage" in console when you first start the game.

Q: Where can I get updates?
A: In order to provide the best reliability, we release new updates as a whole game. This makes it easier for new users to install and reduces the need for users to search for multiple patches. The changelog is posted on WT-F.com
